metadata.title: CVE-2021-2171 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Replication). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.33 andprior and 8.0.23 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows highprivileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatablecrash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.4 (Availabilityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-2171` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
